    • checkPassword

      public boolean checkPassword(int id, String password)
      "Check if the password of the citizen with the given id is equal to the given password." The function is called "checkPassword" and it takes two parameters: an integer and a string. The integer is the id of the citizen and the string is the password. The function returns a boolean value
      Parameters:
      id - The id of the citizen
      password - The password to check.
      Returns:
      A boolean value.

      Returns:
      The applicantId is being returned.

    • pollStateAttorney

      public int pollStateAttorney()
      If there are no state attorneys, return -1, otherwise return the first state attorney in the queue and add it to the end of the queue.
      Returns:
      The first element in the queue.

    • displayLawsuitAcceptingLawyers

      public void displayLawsuitAcceptingLawyers()
      "Get all the lawyers who accept lawsuits." The function is a bit long, but it's not complicated. It's just a loop that iterates over all the lawyers and prints the ones who accept lawsuits

    • peekStateAttorney

      public int peekStateAttorney()
      It returns the first element of the stateAttorneyReferences queue.
      Returns:
      The stateAttorneyReferences.peek() method returns the top element of the queue without removing it.
